==Events==
*[[660 BC]] &ndash; Traditional date for the foundation of [[Japan]] by [[Emperor Jimmu]].
*  [[55]] &ndash; [[Britannicus|Tiberius Claudius Caesar Britannicus]], heir to the [[Roman emperor]]ship, dies under mysterious circumstances in [[Ancient Rome|Rome]]. This clears the way for [[Nero]] to become Emperor.
* [[244]] &ndash; Emperor [[Gordian III]] is murdered by [[mutiny|mutinous]] soldiers in Zaitha ([[Mesopotamia]]). A [[mound]] is raised at [[Carchemish]] in his memory.
*[[1177]] &ndash; [[John de Courcy]]'s army defeats the native Dunleavey Clan in Ulster. The [[England|English]] establish themselves in Ulster.
*[[1531]] &ndash; [[Henry VIII of England]] is recognized as supreme head of the [[Church of England]].
*[[1626]] &ndash; Emperor [[Susenyos I]] of [[Ethiopia]] and Patriarch [[Afonso Mendes]] declare the primacy of the Roman See over the [[Ethiopian Orthodox Tewahedo Church|Ethiopian Church]], and [[Catholic Church|Roman Catholicism]] the state religion of [[Ethiopia]].
*[[1659]] &ndash; [[Assault on Copenhagen (1659)|The assault on Copenhagen]] by [[Sweden|Swedish]] forces is beaten back with heavy losses.
*[[1790]] &ndash; The Religious Society of Friends, also known as [[Quakers]], petitions [[United States Congress|U.S. Congress]] for [[Abolitionism in the United States|abolition]] of [[slavery]].
*[[1794]] &ndash; First session of [[United States Senate]] opens to the public.
*[[1808]] &ndash; [[Jesse Fell]] burns [[anthracite]] on an open grate as an experiment in heating homes with coal.
*[[1812]] &ndash; [[Massachusetts]] governor [[Elbridge Gerry]] "[[gerrymandering|gerrymanders]]" for the first time.
*[[1826]] &ndash; [[University College London]] is founded under the name ''[[University of London]]''.
*  1826   &ndash; [[Swaminarayan]] writes the ''[[Shikshapatri]]'', an important text within [[Swaminarayan Hinduism]].
*[[1840]] &ndash; [[Gaetano Donizetti]]'s opera ''[[La fille du régiment]]'' receives its first performance in [[Paris]], [[France]].
*[[1843]] &ndash; [[Giuseppe Verdi]]'s opera ''[[I Lombardi alla prima crociata]]'' receives its first performance in [[Milan]], [[Italy]].
*[[1855]] &ndash; Kassa Hailu is crowned [[Tewodros II]], [[Emperor of Ethiopia]], by [[Abuna Salama III]] in a ceremony at the church of Derasge Maryam
*[[1856]] &ndash; The Kingdom of [[Awadh]] is annexed by the British [[East India Company]] and [[Wajid Ali Shah]], the king of Awadh, is imprisoned and later exiled to [[Kolkata|Calcutta]].
*[[1858]] &ndash; [[Bernadette Soubirous]]'s first [[Lourdes apparitions|vision]] of the [[Our Lady of Lourdes|Blessed Virgin Mary]] in [[Lourdes]], France.
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[United States House of Representatives]] unanimously passes a resolution guaranteeing noninterference with [[slavery]] in any state.
*[[1873]] &ndash; King [[Amadeo I of Spain]] abdicates.
*[[1889]] &ndash; [[Meiji Constitution]] of Japan is adopted; the first [[National Diet]] convenes in 1890.
*[[1903]] &ndash; [[Anton Bruckner]]'s [[Symphony No. 9 (Bruckner)|9th Symphony]] receives its first performance in [[Vienna]], [[Austria]].
*[[1906]] &ndash; [[Pope Pius X]] publishes the encyclical ''[[Vehementer Nos]]''.
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[Emma Goldman]] is arrested for lecturing on [[birth control]].
*[[1919]] &ndash; [[Friedrich Ebert]] ([[Social Democratic Party of Germany|SPD]]), is elected [[President of Germany]].
*[[1929]] &ndash; [[Kingdom of Italy|Fascist Italy]] and the [[Holy See|Vatican]] sign the [[Lateran Treaty]].
*[[1937]] &ndash; A sit-down strike ends when [[General Motors]] recognizes the [[United Auto Workers]].
*[[1938]] &ndash; [[BBC One|BBC Television]] produces the world's first ever [[Science fiction on television|science fiction television]] program, an adaptation of a section of the [[Karel Čapek]] play ''[[R.U.R.]]'', that coined the term "[[robot]]".
*[[1939]] &ndash; A [[Lockheed P-38 Lightning]] flies from [[California]] to [[New York]] in 7 hours 2 minutes.
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The [[Battle of Bukit Timah]] is fought in [[Singapore]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: [[General (United States)|General]] [[Dwight D. Eisenhower]] is selected to command the [[Allies of World War II|allied]] armies in [[Europe]].
*[[1953]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] Dwight D. Eisenhower refuses a clemency appeal for [[Julius and Ethel Rosenberg]].
*  1953   &ndash; The [[Soviet Union]] breaks off diplomatic relations with [[Israel]].
*[[1959]] &ndash; The [[Federation of Arab Emirates of the South]], which will later become [[South Yemen]], is created as a [[protectorate]] of the [[United Kingdom]].
*[[1964]] &ndash; [[Greece|Greeks]] and [[Turkey|Turks]] begin fighting in [[Limassol]], [[Cyprus]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; Israeli–[[Jordan]]ian border clashes rage.
*  1968   &ndash; The [[Memphis Sanitation Strike]] begins.
*[[1971]] &ndash; Eighty-seven countries, including the United States, United Kingdom, and Soviet Union, sign the [[Seabed Arms Control Treaty]] outlawing [[nuclear weapon]]s on the ocean floor in international waters.
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: First release of American [[prisoner of war|prisoners of war]] from [[Vietnam]] takes place.
*[[1978]] &ndash; [[Censorship]]: China lifts a ban on works by [[Aristotle]], [[William Shakespeare]] and [[Charles Dickens]].
*[[1979]] &ndash; The [[Iranian Revolution]] establishes an Islamic theocracy under the leadership of [[Ayatollah]] [[Ruhollah Khomeini]].
*[[1981]] &ndash; {{convert|100000|USgal|m3}} of radioactive coolant leak into the containment building of [[Tennessee Valley Authority|TVA]] [[Sequoyah Nuclear Generating Station|Sequoyah 1]] nuclear plant in [[Tennessee]], contaminating 8 workers.
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[Nelson Mandela]] is released from [[Drakenstein Correctional Centre|Victor Verster Prison]] outside [[Cape Town]], [[South Africa]] after 27 years as a political prisoner.
*1990 &ndash; [[Buster Douglas]], a 40-1 underdog, knocks out [[Mike Tyson]] in ten rounds at Tokyo to win [[boxing]]'s world Heavyweight title and cause one of the largest upsets in sports history.
*[[1997]] &ndash; [[Space Shuttle Discovery|Space Shuttle ''Discovery'']] is launched on a [[STS-82|mission]] to service the [[Hubble Space Telescope]].
*[[2008]] &ndash; Rebel [[East Timor]]ese soldiers [[2008 East Timorese assassination attempts|seriously wound]] President [[José Ramos-Horta]]. Rebel leader [[Alfredo Reinado]] is killed in the attack.
*  2008   &ndash; [[Namdaemun]], a 550-year-old gate in [[South Korea]], was [[2008 Namdaemun fire|toppled]] by fire.
*[[2011]] &ndash; The [[Timeline of the 2011 Egyptian revolution under Hosni Mubarak's rule|first wave]] of the [[2011 Egyptian revolution|Egyptian revolution]] culminates in the resignation of [[Hosni Mubarak]] and the transfer of power to the Supreme Military Council after 18 days of protests.
*[[2013]] &ndash;  [[Pope Benedict XVI]] announces his resignation from the papacy, the first pontiff to resign in more than half a millennium.
*[[2014]] &ndash; A military transport [[2014 Algeria Lockheed C-130 Hercules crash|plane crashes]] in a mountainous area of [[Oum El Bouaghi Province]] in eastern [[Algeria]], killing 77 people.
